alert.note: Alert for Prince William (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 22 at 2:19PM EDT until June 22 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 300 PM EDT FOR WEST CENTRAL CHARLES...STAFFORD...KING GEORGE...SOUTHEASTERN CULPEPER...SOUTHEASTERN PRINCE WILLIAM AND EASTERN SPOTSYLVANIA COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF FREDERICKSBURG... At 218 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms with a history of producing measured wind gusts in excess of 60 mph were located along a line extending from near Quantico to near Fredericksburg, moving south at 35 mph. HAZARD...65 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Stafford, Fredericksburg, King George, Quantico, Fairview Beach, Potomac Creek, Aquia Creek, Triangle, Dumfries, Massaponax, Spotsylvania, Cherry Hill, Falmouth, Passapatanzy, Potomac Heights, Stones Corner, Weedonville, Roseville, Garrisonville and Ironsides. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: This storm has a history of producing measured wind gusts in excess of 60 mph. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
